Class BinaryTree.BTNode

java.lang.Object
datastructure.tree.BinaryTree.BTNode
Direct Known Subclasses:
AVLTree.AVLNode
Enclosing class:
BinaryTree<K,D>
public class BinaryTree.BTNode extends Object
Class representing a node in a Binary Tree

    • min

      public BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode min()
      Returns the leftmost node in the subtree rooted at this node; Cost: O(h)

      Equivalent to a linear search on a node-leaf path

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Best-case cost: O(1)
      where h is the height of the Binary Tree
      Returns:
      null or the the leftmost node in the subtree rooted at this node

    • max

      public BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode max()
      Returns the rightmost node in the subtree rooted at this node; Cost: O(h)

      Equivalent to a linear search on a node-leaf path

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Best-case cost: O(1)
      where h is the height of the Binary Tree
      Returns:
      null or the the rightmost node in the subtree rooted at this node

    • predecessor

      public BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode predecessor()
      Returns the predecessor of this node in a in-order visit; Cost: O(h)

      The predecessor is searched on a root-leaf path

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Best-case cost: O(1)
      where h is the height of the Binary Tree
      Returns:
      the predecessor of this node

    • successor

      public BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode successor()
      Returns the successor of this node in a in-order visit; Cost: O(h)

      The successor is searched on a root-leaf path

      • Worst-case cost: Θ(h)
      • Best-case cost: O(1)
      where h is the height of the Binary Tree
      Returns:
      the successor of this node

    • swap

      public void swap(BinaryTree<K,D>.BTNode node) throws IllegalStateException
      Swaps key and data values of this node with those of the input node; Cost: O(1)
      Parameters:
      node - a Binary Tree node
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the node passed as argument is null

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect() throws IllegalStateException
      Disconnects this node from the Binary Tree if it has only one child; Cost: O(1)

      If this node is a leaf, it just disconnects it from the tree, while if it has a child, its unique child is inerithed by his father (it becomes the new root if this node is the root node)

      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this node has two children

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representing the mapping (key,data) stored in this node; Cost: O(1)

      The string has the format X[key,data], where

      • if the node is a left chid then X = 'L'
      • if the node is a right child then X = 'R'
      • if the node is the root node then X = 'ROOT'
      Null data is not printed
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
